conversation with Jim Hirsch. Friday, March 20, 6 p.m </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;5d5cdc63.1503</link>   <description> FYI, in case you are in the Chicago area.<br><br>-----<br>Gabriel Rei-Doval<br>http://www4.uwm.edu/letsci/spanish/faculty/reidoval.cfm<br><br>Begin forwarded message:<br><br>From: Instituto Cervantes of Chicago &lt;info.chicago@cervantes.org&lt;mailto:info.chicago@cervantes.org&gt;&gt;<br>Subject: Cristina Pato in conversation with Jim Hirsch. Friday, March 20, 6 p.m<br>Date: March 10, 2015 at 5:01:54 PM CDT<br>To: reidoval@uwm.edu&lt;mailto:reidoval@uwm.edu&gt;<br>Reply-To: info.chicago@cervantes.org&lt;mailto:info.chicago@cervantes.org&gt;<br><br>Having trouble viewing this email? Click here&lt;http://campaign.r20.constantcontact.com/render?ca=7d627768-bc1b-4d80-aa3a-e1ad4e99782c&amp;c=f1bbd9d0-502c-11e3-bdea-d4ae529ce120&amp;ch=f22c4ee0-502c-11e3-be3e-d4ae529ce120&gt;<br><br>[Instituto Cervantes Chicago]&lt;http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001vBctDMsTrXSL5amVcydlWeUWov6rJ7Rq1XHhiofIpaUdYPl8cqey6E0lu-0jqjIDS_kp_8KGQLspY-mtk-PbgS-6Na0-uM3SqQnLR9nSbCvvfDZiL-uO8v36mj4w15_Xrh4c6FWpjDzvCQvihUS-_Yqx_Q9d4Qc_UEyngYwotwzZTelohoeLVl-vGRNZezgO7OHUIBKwYRE=&amp;c=GArHW_ZVNs_rxqeckQjZa-HPt6Y3tXWIHOITNZ1CeM1Urg-CxnoZ1A==&amp;ch=yzl8sGOu3oHSHjJaxEsQb3bPBiJ5gGT6fh4LW9ilCqjD8A7xsHfPQg==&gt;<br><br>[CRISTINA PATO IN CONVERSATION WITH JIM HIRSCH]&lt;http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001vBctDMsTrXSL5amVcydlWeUWov6rJ7Rq1XHhiofIpaUdYPl8cqey6JeJyVTsFWjOqDsKAoWEdBAfT7A9OIA0Sh8hpN4GIkj3Drmf7cJVy_IdzhM8thCtJqtnUUiPkdZ5KhQVscdJhGEY5SEapKjpU-GfFS7Ovm0O8AwEIcX4JWU8mJp6AuZqiA==&amp;c=GArHW_ZVNs_rxqeckQjZa-HPt6Y3tXWIHOITNZ1CeM1Urg-CxnoZ1A==&amp;ch=yzl8sGOu3oHSHjJaxEsQb3bPBiJ5gGT6fh4LW9ilCqjD8A7xsHfPQg==&gt; [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T22:25:27+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Gabriel Rei-Doval</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;5d5cdc63.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;5cd44f3a.1502">   <title>Conference on Identity and Nation (Trinity College Dublin, June 2015) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;5cd44f3a.1502</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br><br>On the link below please find information about the conference 'Pulling Together or Pulling Apart: Identity and Nationhood - Spain, Europe, the West' (Trinity College Dublin, 25-27 June 2015), of potential interest for Galician Studies scholars:<br><br>https://www.tcd.ie/Hispanic_Studies/ptpa-conference/<br><br>Best wishes,<br><br>Mart\ufffd\ufffdn<br><br>Dr Mart\ufffd\ufffdn Veiga<br>Lecturer, Department of Spanish, Portuguese and Latin American Studies<br>Director, Irish Centre for Galician Studies<br>School of Languages, Literatures and Cultures<br>University College Cork<br>Cork<br>Ireland<br>T +353(0)214902108<br>F +353(0)214903264<br>E m.veiga@ucc.ie    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-25T10:58:26+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Veiga, Martin</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;5cd44f3a.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;cd3ca1fe.1502">   <title>Symposium on Pilgrimage Studies Oct. 16-18, 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;cd3ca1fe.1502</link>   <description> CALL FOR ABSTRACTS<br>The Interdisciplinarity of Pilgrimage Studies<br><br>An Interdisciplinary Conference Sponsored by<br><br>the Institute for Pilgrimage Studies and<br><br>the International Consortium for Pilgrimage Studies<br><br>College of William &amp; Mary<br><br>October 16-18, 2015<br><br>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdCuriosity does, no less than devotion, pilgrims make.\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>Abraham Cowley (English Poet 1618-1667)<br><br>The Institute of Pilgrimage Studies in conjunction with the International Consortium for Pilgrimage Studies invites abstracts for the 4th annual Symposium October 16-18, 2015 at the College of William &amp; Mary, Williamsburg, Virginia. Encouraged themes:<br>Pilgrimage in the College Curriculum / Pilgrimage and Popular Culture<br>Sociology of Pilgrimage / Jewish Pilgrimage / The Body [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-24T20:08:38+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Greenia, George D</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;cd3ca1fe.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;cbb35f3b.1502">   <title>MLA 2016: "Dialogues Across the Mi\ufffd\ufffdo"</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;cbb35f3b.1502</link>   <description> Dear colleagues:<br><br>I would like to invite those of you who are planning to attend the 2016 Modern Language Association convention in Austin to submit an abstract to the following session, which is co-organized by the American Association of Teachers of Spanish and Portuguese (AATSP) and the Luso-Brazilian Studies division of the MLA. This session has been organized to celebrate the MLA’s institutional recognition of Galician Studies, as well as the myriad connections that exist between the fields of Galician and Portuguese studies: [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-14T19:59:42-08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Robert Newcomb</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;cbb35f3b.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;13df3fa3.1502">   <title>Fwd: Call for papers: Cibercultura, linguaxes e medialidade </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;13df3fa3.1502</link>   <description> P\ufffd\ufffdr se \ufffd\ufffd do voso interese.<br><br>Sa\ufffd\ufffddos cordiais,<br>Gabriel<br><br>---------- Forwarded message ----------<br>From: *Burghard Baltrusch* &lt;burg@uvigo.es&gt;<br>Date: Friday, February 13, 2015<br>Subject: Call for papers: Cibercultura, linguaxes e medialidade<br>To:<br><br>A coordinaci\ufffd\ufffdn da secci\ufffd\ufffdn<br><br>*\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdCibercultura, linguaxes e medialidade:<br>&lt;http://www.lusitanistentag2015.rwth-aachen.de/pt/congresso/seccoes/seccao-12/&gt;*<br><br>*hibridaci\ufffd\ufffdn e conflito nos espazos xeoculturais galego e lus\ufffd\ufffdfono\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br>&lt;http://www.lusitanistentag2015.rwth-aachen.de/pt/congresso/seccoes/seccao-12/&gt;*<br><br>do 11\ufffd\ufffd Congresso Alem\ufffd\ufffdo de Lusitanistas<br>&lt;http://www.lusitanistentag2015.rwth-aachen.de/pt/congresso/tema-geral/&gt;<br>(Aachen, 16-19/09/2015) solicita o env\ufffd\ufffdo de propostas de relatorios (20<br>minutos). [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-13T17:54:01+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Gabriel P\ufffd\ufffdrez</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;13df3fa3.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;55d9ae72.1502">   <title>Re: Symposium 'Translation, Language and Performance on the Galician Stage': Second CFP (University College Cork, 1-2 April 2015) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;55d9ae72.1502</link>   <description> Hola Mart\ufffd\ufffdn:<br><br>Solamente saludarte desde California.<br>Y de saber algo del tema con gusto me apuntaba, tengo ganas de<br>regresar a Irlanda--me enamor\ufffd\ufffd de Dubl\ufffd\ufffdn pero nunca he estado en Cork.<br>\ufffd\ufffdQu\ufffd\ufffd tal todo?<br>Apertas--Silvia<br><br>Quoting &quot;Veiga, Martin&quot; &lt;M.Veiga@UCC.IE&gt;:<br><br>&gt; Dear Galician Studies colleagues,<br>&gt;<br>&gt; On the following link please find the second CFP for the symposium<br>&gt; 'Translation, Language and Performance on the Galician Stage', which<br>&gt; will take place at University College Cork on 1-2 April 2015. Please<br>&gt; send your proposals by 28 February:<br>&gt;<br>&gt; http://www.ucc.ie/en/media/academic/hispanicstudies/2CFPGalician.pdf<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Best wishes,<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Mart\ufffd\ufffdn<br>&gt;<br>> [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-11T08:59:48-08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Silvia Berm\ufffd\ufffddez</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;55d9ae72.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;690d543c.1502">   <title>Symposium 'Translation, Language and Performance on the Galician Stage': Second CFP (University College Cork, 1-2 April 2015) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;690d543c.1502</link>   <description> Dear Galician Studies colleagues,<br><br>On the following link please find the second CFP for the symposium 'Translation, Language and Performance on the Galician Stage', which will take place at University College Cork on 1-2 April 2015. Please send your proposals by 28 February:<br><br>http://www.ucc.ie/en/media/academic/hispanicstudies/2CFPGalician.pdf<br><br>Best wishes,<br><br>Mart\ufffd\ufffdn<br><br>Dr Mart\ufffd\ufffdn Veiga<br>Lecturer, Department of Spanish, Portuguese and Latin American Studies<br>Director, Irish Centre for Galician Studies<br>School of Languages, Literatures and Cultures<br>University College Cork<br>Cork<br>Ireland<br>T +353(0)214902108<br>F +353(0)214903264<br>E m.veiga@ucc.ie    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-11T16:47:03+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Veiga, Martin</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;690d543c.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;8ab0d54c.1502">   <title>Bulletin of Hispanic Studies - New Issue Alert </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;8ab0d54c.1502</link>   <description> Dear member,<br><br>Volume 92, Number 2 / 2015 of Bulletin of Hispanic Studies is now available on the liverpool.metapress.com website at http://liverpool.metapress.com/content/q02028255457/.<br><br>Bulletin of Hispanic Studies is the foremost journal published in Britain devoted to the languages, literatures and civilizations of Spain, Portugal and Latin America. You can keep up to date with the journal by clicking here&lt;https://liverpool.metapress.com/content/121622/toc-alert&gt; to sign up to new issue alerts, and can learn more about the title at its website page here&lt;http://www.liverpooluniversitypress.co.uk/index.php?option=com_content&amp;view=article&amp;id=45%3Abulletin-of-hispanic-studies-the-&amp;catid=8&amp;Itemid=21&gt;. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-09T12:24:47+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Baldry, Chantel</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;8ab0d54c.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;26d5ef28.1501">   <title>FW: Libros sobre Galicia </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;26d5ef28.1501</link>   <description> Amigos galicianistas,<br><br>Rem\ufffd\ufffdtovos este correo que recib\ufffd\ufffdn, xunto co documento que trae anexo, porque a colecci\ufffd\ufffdn de libros que te\ufffd\ufffden \ufffd\ufffd venda pode ser do voso inter\ufffd\ufffds.<br><br>Apertas a todos,<br><br>Benita Sampedro<br>-------<br><br>From: Libros la Pe\ufffd\ufffda &lt;unospocoslibrosraros@gmail.com&lt;mailto:unospocoslibrosraros@gmail.com&gt;&gt;<br>Reply-To: Libros la Pe\ufffd\ufffda &lt;libreria@libreria-anticuaria.com&lt;mailto:libreria@libreria-anticuaria.com&gt;&gt;<br>Date: Thu, 29 Jan 2015 17:47:13 +0100<br>To: &lt;libreria@libreria-anticuaria.com&lt;mailto:libreria@libreria-anticuaria.com&gt;&gt;<br>Subject: Libros sobre Galicia<br><br>Bon d\ufffd\ufffda:<br><br>Somos uns modestos libreiros galegos radicados na bisbarra da Axarqu\ufffd\ufffda (M\ufffd\ufffdlaga), traballando desde fai mais de vinte anos no libro antigo e de ocasi\ufffd\ufffdn. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-31T00:00:13+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Benita Sampedro</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;26d5ef28.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;a36f1ce2.1501">   <title>CFP: MLA 2016 (Austin, Texas) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;a36f1ce2.1501</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>The new Galician Forum of the MLA is delighted to invite submissions for our inaugural session/s, which will take place at the MLA Annual Convention in Austin, Texas, in January 2016. The text of the CFP is pasted below; logged-in MLA members can view it directly on the website: http://www.mla.org/cfp_detail_7508 [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-29T11:18:08+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hooper, Kirsty</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;a36f1ce2.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;61bf242.1501">   <title>Bulletin of Hispanic Studies - New Issue Alert </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;61bf242.1501</link>   <description> Dear members,<br><br>Volume 91, Number 8 / 2014 of Bulletin of Hispanic Studies is now available on the liverpool.metapress.com website at http://liverpool.metapress.com/content/mt6075011341/.<br><br>Bulletin of Hispanic Studies is the foremost journal published in Britain devoted to the languages, literatures and civilizations of Spain, Portugal and Latin America. You can keep up to date with the journal by clicking here&lt;https://liverpool.metapress.com/content/121622/toc-alert&gt; to sign up to new issue alerts, and can learn more about the title at its website page here&lt;http://www.liverpooluniversitypress.co.uk/index.php?option=com_content&amp;view=article&amp;id=45%3Abulletin-of-hispanic-studies-the-&amp;catid=8&amp;Itemid=21&gt;. LUP authors may donate all or part of their royalties to the Fund, and all contributions are then match-funded by the press. Please pass on our congratulations to David.<br><br>How are things going, BTW?<br><br>Cheers,<br><br>Bettina<br><br>Bettina Arnold<br><br>Professor<br>Department of Anthropology<br>PO Box 413<br>University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee<br>Milwaukee, WI 53201<br>USA    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-11T16:56:53+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Bettina Arnold</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;c3926d3.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;99ae0124.1412">   <title>David Mackenzie, Premio da Cultura Galega 2014 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;99ae0124.1412</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>As some of you know, yesterday December 10th the Premios da Cultura Galega (Galician Culture Awards) 2014 were presented by the Xunta de Galicia in Santiago de Compostela: http://cultura.xunta.es/gl/nova/6721?utm_source=news_gal&amp;utm_medium=email&amp;utm_campaign=boletin_gal<br><br>A member of this list, David Mackenzie, was awarded such prize in the Galician Language modalidade or section. As appropriatedly noted yesterday in Santiago de Compostela, o galego David Mackenzie started his efforts spreading Galician Language and Culture internationally in the 1980s and was in 1994 when he became the first (Full) Professor of Galician Studies in English-speaking Academia. I believe it’s fully truthful, as also noted yesterday, his: [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-11T16:27:02+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Gabriel Rei-Doval</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;99ae0124.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;a07f43fd.1412">   <title>Fwd: 2\ufffd\ufffd circular Gallaecia - III Congresso Internacional de Lingu\ufffd\ufffdstica Hist\ufffd\ufffdrica</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;a07f43fd.1412</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;a07f43fd.1412">Fwd: 2\ufffd\ufffd circular Gallaecia - III Congresso Internacional de Lingu\ufffd\ufffdstica Hist\ufffd\ufffdrica</a></description>   <dc:date>2014-12-10T14:30:56+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Gabriel Rei-Doval</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;a07f43fd.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;1a6d46de.1412">   <title>Re: MLA Galician LLC Forum: The end of the beginning </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;1a6d46de.1412</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>Attached is the description of a full/advanced associate professor position that has being opened at the Spanish and Portuguese program at my university, Texas Tech. This is Janet Perez' position (she has retired last year) and it comes with a Qualia chair endowment. I would like to encourage you to apply if you fit the qualifications or let anybody who may be interested know about it. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-02T23:07:31+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Pereira, Carmen</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;1a6d46de.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;9c73053e.1411">   <title>Galicia 21: Journal of Contemporary Galician Studies - Editorial Change </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;9c73053e.1411</link>   <description> Dear friends and colleagues from the field of Galician Studies,<br><br>This is to let you know that, after five years as editor of the journal Galicia 21: Journal of Contemporary Galician Studies, Dr Helena Migu\ufffd\ufffdlez-Carballeira and Mar\ufffd\ufffda Li\ufffd\ufffdeira (as book review editor) will pass the editorship to the lecturers and researchers Dr Mart\ufffd\ufffdn Veiga (University College Cork) and Dr David Miranda-Barreiro (Bangor University). The journal begins a new and exciting period, but will continue its work as annual journal specialised in Galician Studies, in open access, peer-reviewed and index linked. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-26T19:25:05+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Veiga, Martin</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;9c73053e.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;65f8caee.1411">   <title>Conference 'Translation, Language and Performance on the Galician Stage': Call for Papers (University College Cork) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;65f8caee.1411</link>   <description> Dear Galician Studies colleagues,<br><br>On the links below please find the Call for Papers for the conference 'Translation, Language and Performance on the Galician Stage', which will take place at University College Cork on the 1st and 2nd April 2015. Please send your abstracts by Friday 30th January 2015:<br><br>http://www.ucc.ie/en/splas/newsevents/fullstory-509237-en.html<br><br>http://www.ucc.ie/en/media/academic/hispanicstudies/galiciancentre/CFP_TranslationPerformance_UCC.pdf<br><br>Best wishes,<br><br>Mart\ufffd\ufffdn<br><br>Dr Mart\ufffd\ufffdn Veiga<br>Lecturer, Department of Spanish, Portuguese and Latin American Studies<br>Director, Irish Centre for Galician Studies<br>School of Languages, Literatures and Cultures<br>University College Cork<br>Cork<br>Ireland<br>T +353(0)214902108<br>F +353(0)214903264<br>E m.veiga@ucc.ie    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-19T20:34:34+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Veiga, Martin</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;65f8caee.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;946134cc.1411">   <title>Re: MLA Galician LLC Forum: The end of the beginning </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;946134cc.1411</link>   <description> Parab\ufffd\ufffdns tam\ufffd\ufffdn dende Vigo por este excelente traballo.<br>Sa\ufffd\ufffddo cordial<br>Burghard Baltrusch<br>Em 14/11/2014 12:27, &quot;Debora Campos&quot; &lt;camposdebora@gmail.com&gt; escreveu:<br><br>&gt; Moitos parab\ufffd\ufffdns Gabriel!<br>&gt; Sa\ufffd\ufffddos!<br>&gt;<br>&gt; D\ufffd\ufffdbora Campos<br>&gt;<br>&gt; El viernes, 14 de noviembre de 2014, Pereira, Carmen &lt;<br>&gt; carmen.pereira@ttu.edu&gt; escribi\ufffd\ufffd:<br>&gt;<br>&gt;&gt; Que boas novas!<br>&gt;&gt;<br>&gt;&gt;<br>&gt;&gt;<br>&gt;&gt; Moitisimas gracias a todos os que fixeron este excelente traballo.<br>&gt;&gt;<br>&gt;&gt;<br>&gt;&gt;<br>&gt;&gt; Carmen<br>&gt;&gt; ------------------------------<br>&gt;&gt; *From:* Galician Studies e-mail discussion list [<br>&gt;&gt; GALICIAN-STUDIES@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] on behalf of Antia G. Doubleday</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;fb85362e.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;714951b5.1411">   <title>MLA Galician LLC Forum: The end of the beginning </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;714951b5.1411</link>   <description> Dear all,<br>Today we have excellent news to share.<br>The MLA Galician Language, Literature and Culture (LLC) Forum has finally (just) been approved. The decision is final and the first official MLA Galician LLC Forum session will take place at the 2016 convention in Austin.<br>Thanks to everyone who made this unprecedented accomplishment possible.<br>Let me take Winston Churchill’s 1942 words to say, this time for Galician Studies worldwide, that &quot;this is not the end. It is not even the beginning of the end. But it is, perhaps, the end of the beginning\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd.<br>Apertas galicianistas desde Milwaukee,<br>Gabriel<br>-----<br>Gabriel [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-14T01:07:35+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Gabriel Rei-Doval</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;714951b5.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;4bdf4dc1.1411">   <title>Poetry reading by Isaac Xub\ufffd\ufffdn in Cork</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;4bdf4dc1.1411</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br><br>I am delighted to inform you that next Tuesday 18th November the Galician poet Isaac Xub\ufffd\ufffdn will offer a multilingual reading of Iberian poetry in Cork. All welcome.<br><br>More information below and on the following link:<br><br>http://galegoencork.com/poetry-reading-isaac-xubin/<br><br>Best wishes,<br><br>Mart\ufffd\ufffdn<br><br>Dr Mart\ufffd\ufffdn Veiga<br>Lecturer, Department of Spanish, Portuguese and Latin American Studies<br>Director, Irish Centre for Galician Studies<br>School of Languages, Literatures and Cultures<br>University College Cork<br>Cork<br>Ireland<br>T +353(0)214902108<br>F +353(0)214903264<br>E m.veiga@ucc.ie    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-13T00:28:18+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Veiga, Martin</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;4bdf4dc1.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;f87009b.1411">   <title>I Coloquio Internacional de Estudos Literarios en Vigo </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;f87009b.1411</link>   <description> Os vindeiros d\ufffd\ufffdas 13 e 14 de novembro ter\ufffd\ufffd lugar, no Sal\ufffd\ufffdn de Graos da FFT<br>(B3), o I Coloquio Internacional de Estudos Literarios en Vigo<br>&lt;http://doutoramentoestudosliterarios.blogspot.com.es/2014/11/i-coloquio-internacional-estudos.html&gt;<br>que<br>organiza o Programa de Doutoramento Interuniversitario en Estudos Literarios<br>&lt;http://doutoramentoestudosliterarios.blogspot.com.es/p/doutoramento-en-estudos-literarios.html&gt;<br>.<br><br>A asistencia \ufffd\ufffd gratu\ufffd\ufffdta. Para o alumnado da Universidade de Vigo a<br>asistencia \ufffd\ufffd convalid\ufffd\ufffdbel por 20 horas (1 cr\ufffd\ufffddito ECTS). Interesadas e<br>interesados poden enviar un correo-e (con nome, apelidos e DNI) a<br>doutoramentoestudosliterarios@uvigo.es solicitando o certificado<br>correspondente. A asistencia controlarase antes do inicio de cada sesi\ufffd\ufffdn de<br>comunicaci\ufffd\ufffdns. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-07T10:55:13+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Burghard Baltrusch</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=GALICIAN-STUDIES;f87009b.1411</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
